21.heading: Diameters.
21.title: "The Rocket Lanes of Tomorrow"
21.author: Joe Simon & Jack Kirby
21.appears_in: 2 p. in Real Fact Comics, no. 1 (Mar./Apr. 1946) ; in Mystery in Space, no. 4 (Oct./Nov. 1951) ; in My Greatest Adventure, no. 43 (May 1960) ; in New Gods, no. 6 (Jan. 1972)
notes: Summary: Predicts personal rocket packs, space flight, and tunnels through the diameter of the Earth.

22.heading: Diamond, Amanda.
22.title: "Manga Madness"
22.author: by Christine Rook
22.appears_in: p. 1D, 6D in The State Journal, Feb. 27, 2003.
notes: "Today's teens aren't satisfied with just reading and watching Japanese-style animation; they're creating their own art."
Shows local artists Amanda Diamond and Christ Hill, and quotes comics retailer Stephen Jahner and art teacher Shavaughn Simon.

23.heading: Diamond, Dangerous Jack.
23.title: "Bobo's New York Adventure"
23.author: John Broome, script ; Carmine Infantino, art
23.appears_in: 6 p. in The Adventures of Rex the Wonder Dog, no. 35 (Sept./Oct. 1957) ; reprinted in Tarzan, no. 235 (Feb./Mar. 1975).
notes: Summary: Bobo tails Dangerous Jack Diamond, the jewel thief, to New York, captures him and then guest hosts a TV show.
Data from Gene Reed via Grand Comics Database Project.
